Ratings.comment: Dr Day is very nice and funny, but she gives a ton of homework to do. All tests were outside of class, receptive tests were good but the culture tests were usually hard. She doesn't grade hard which is good, but it can just be a lot sometimes.

Her course was mostly easy. However, she didn't care to make the class interactive or engaging. For a class that needs visual interaction to actually learn, this was frustrating. We met 1-2 times a week synchronously. Her class wasn't organized well. She uploaded assignments irregularly and we never knew if we were having class until the last min.

He is super funny and genuinely cares about his student's mental health. There are quizzes that aren't too hard and he'll always repeat a sign if you missed it or need a little more help. He's got clear grading criteria for the expressive tests as well. Marshall is really patient and a generous grader who will always help when you need it.

He was a great professor. He is deaf so you learn so much more because voices are off. Not a lot of homework or tests. He is not very good at Carmen or updating assignments. I didn't get to see my grade until the last week of classes which sucked. Overall he is a great professor and really cares about his students.

Every day was my favorite. He is engaging, understanding (both of whatever level ASL you are at and personal issues), and the sweetest man alive. I learned a ton more about ASL and deaf culture. He cares that we understand, and will slow down and take any questions you have. I have not met a more caring professor in my time at OSU. PLEASE TAKE!!

He is amazing! I highly recommend taking Steve's class. Super funny, kind, and willing to help. Easy grader. He is deaf, which makes the class very immersive and engaging. Almost every class consisted of a lecture giving new signs, as well as small group practice. Only a few assignments outside of class. I will miss him, he is truly a great person.

I LOVED HIM SO MUCH!!!! Truly so funny, and I learned so so so much from him in just class. Great personality, so a great class to take if you're interested in simply learning ASL or if you need the GE language credit.
Steve is the most amazing professor!! He is so kind and caring towards his students and only wants you to succeed. I grew such an appreciation for ASL in his class and learned so much.
I LOVE HIM. He is the sweetest professor I have ever had and makes ASL so fun and easy to learn. He is very understanding towards students and does not want to make your life difficult.
Great professor, and very approachable during and after class. He is also very humorous and an overall sweet guy.
The greatest man I've ever known. Professor Barabas cares so much about his classes and his students, and he's such a great teacher. 10000/10 would recommend.
He was amazing, very friendly, engaging, and committed to accommodating students needs in order to best learn.  I 100% recommend taking his class.
Kind and caring. Tried to make class fun . Help deepen my understanding of ASL and deaf culture.

Lauren is the best! She so evidently cares for her students and wants them to succeed in her class. Attendance is mandatory but class was always fun and filled with activities to learn and practice ASL. The voices off environment really helped with sign repetition and receptive skills. I wish I could have her as my teacher for every ASL class!

Lauren is the kindest, most caring professor I've ever had. She makes learning ASL a blast and I've truly come to respect the language. She gives amazing feedback and never makes students feel bad or "slow" for not understanding. I would take every ASL course with her if I could!

Lauren is an amazing professor and was especially kind. She takes time in class to make sure everyone understands and is comprehending material. She cares about each of her students a lot and is an amazing teacher!

Lauren is one of the best professors I have ever had. She cares so much about her students and even checks in with them personally if they are feeling off. She is an inspirational teacher and has made learning ASL so fun and accessible. I hope to take more classes with her in the future!

She is amazing, I took her last semester and loved her. She is so understanding and sweet, she made such a nice environment for my class to learn in. I've never felt welcomed in a class like that before.
I learned so much in ASL 3, and became much more confident in my signing abilities. Lauren really seems to care about her students and what she teaches. Highly recommend!

BEST ASL PROFESSOR EVER!! Lauren cares more about you more than just a student at OSU. You are her ASL student. She is so understanding, therefore is so helpful and make you feel so comfortable. 

Everyone please take a class with her and receive the same impact that she left on me.

Lauren is an AMAZING professor. I wish i could have taken a class with her each semester. She is so so so so so caring so understanding and such an amazing person very passionate about her students and about students learning. She is a go with the flow type of professor which leads a helping hand to how class is conducted, very informal and fun.

Professor Sanders is such a caring professor, and she makes learning ASL interesting and fun! You can tell she genuinely wants you to succeed, so she makes herself 100% available to get help if you need it. Go to lecture and you'll do just fine in the class - Lauren is the best!

Lauren is amazing! Really cares about students. Lots of material in this class, but she makes it fun, so as long as you come to class you won't need to study much outside of class. Makes the stressful expression tests less nerve racking. Gives great feedback.
Take ASL with Lauren, she's the best! Her class is fun and she's so supportive and understanding. 13/10 would recommend.

Lauren is amazing, and one of the sweetest people that I have met. She truly cares about her students, and does her best to make class fun and interactive. Her tests and assignments are extremely easy, and showing up to class is the best way to learn the material. Easily one of my favorite professors at Ohio State.

Amazing! Cares about students inside and outside the classroom, has great activities that keep class fun, and always looks for student feedback to improve herself. Genuinely wants students to learn, and she does a great job to help them!

Lauren is amazing, she loves her job, and she gets very close with her students. She was always prepared, she was always in a good mood. She always offered to help with anything. I absolutely love her, she is one of my favorite professors that I've had the pleasure of learning from. The ASL department just knows how to do it right.

She's really, really nice and makes classes fun. I wish all of my professors were this supportive. ASL 1101 was my highest grade this semester and it's due mostly to how helpful and encouraging Lauren is. I wish I could have her again next semester.
I love her. I really wish she was going to be my ASL 3 professor.  Lauren is so understanding.

One of the BEST professors I've ever had. She is beyond helpful and will definitely go out of her way to make sure you understand the material. Any flaws in the class are that of the ASL program structure and not of her teaching.
Lauren is a wonderful teacher!! I recommend her to anyone. She is such a nice and caring person. She is so funny and really makes ASL fun! She is my all-time favorite ASL teacher.

If you get Lauren as your professor, thank your lucky stars! She is absolutely PHENOMENAL and I will miss her immensely once this semester is over. She is so passionate about what she does that it is very infectious! You will walk away feeling better having known her and with an A if you are willing to meet her halfway!
Lauren is an amazing teacher. I love going to her class. She's very helpful and a pretty easy grader. Also, she's HOT! One of my favorite teachers at OSU.
Lauren is probably the best teacher I've had at Ohio State. She's fun and upbeat and keeps the class entertained. She is super easy to talk to and helpful with everything. Highly recommend her!
Great professor.  For teaching a language, she is as good as it gets.

Lauren is the best college instructor I have ever had. She is excited to teach every day and has an extremely positive attitude about teaching and her students. She has a great sense of humor and has plenty of educational activities for us to practice our new vocabulary with. Choose Lauren as your instructor!

I've had Lauren for two different ASL sections, and I must say her teaching style was my favorite. She's always been very helpful and understanding, and really seems to love what she does. Very much recommended.

Best teacher ever! I love her. She is the most entertaining teacher I have ever had. I wish all my professors are like her! She is very helpful, positive, funny, kind, intelligent, etc. I could go on and on! SHE IS GREAT!
Lauren was awesome. She was very clear and easy to understand. She is an awesome teacher.

This was my first ASL class but I can't imagine a better teacher. She is all about making sure you understand and makes ASL really fun. You do have to go to class because you will fall behind quickly if you don't, but I never minded going to this class.  I would highly recommend Lauren for any ASL level.

Lauren is one of my favorite teachers! She is extremely nice, funny, and very easy to learn from. The class itself is kind of difficult, but if you are interested and pay attention when she signs, you can really pick up a lot.

Lauren has been the best teacher I have ever had. She is always there to help and is always willing to go the extra mile to make sure her students get it. ASL is hard to learn but she makes it easy, she teaches at our level. I would recommend her hands down, she is an amazing teacher!!

Kristin cares about her students. A large portion of the class covers casual signing so Kristen teaches parts of the class in a casual register to teach by example. This is very helpful for immersion in the language. Assignments are not difficult and extensions are easily accessible.
She actually made the class interesting despite it being all online. She is super nice and offers many extra credit opportunities.

She is an incredible instructor. She is extremely engaging during lessons, provides extra information to make lessons more interesting, and it is clear she has a passion for teaching and helping students. There are a few assignments each unit, but they are very manageable. Only thing to note is that attendance is important to her and your success!

A fine professor! Conveyed the information well, very organized. My only qualms was a) the expressive tests are done sitting in front of her which just does not make for the most natural comfortable environment...potentially explaining mistakes. and b) her attendance is very very strict. Miss a few classes and your grade will be heavily affected

I LOVE Heidi. She is by far my favorite professor. Not only is she extremely personable but you can tell she loves what she is doing. She made asl so much fun and a new passion of mine. If can get her as your professor, do it!

Dr. Kinnamon is such a down to earth and genuine person inside and out of the classroom. She has the most adorable and sweet personality making the classroom feel almost like family. She is also amazing at teaching, always makes content learning fun, realistic and easy. There is never a dull moment with Heidi- she is so hilarious and relatable.

Heidi is my favorite professor so far. She makes learning insanely fun and even for a class that meets four days a week I never found myself not wanting to go. She cares about all of her students a great deal and teaches sign language in such a respectful way for a teacher that is not deaf herself.
